skill.name: pr-description-writer
skill.description: Generates comprehensive, reviewer-friendly PR descriptions with visual diagrams, summary tables, collapsible sections, and structured test plans. Optimized for readability without sacrificing detail.

skill.author: DiversioTeam

security_audit.summary: Pure prompt-based skill with no executable code. Contains only documentation and instructions for writing PR descriptions using standard git/GitHub commands. No malicious patterns, data exfiltration, or suspicious network behavior detected.

content.user_title: Write detailed PR descriptions with visual elements
content.value_statement: Writing clear, comprehensive PR descriptions takes significant time and effort. This skill automates the creation of reviewer-friendly descriptions using structured formatting, visual diagrams, and organized sections.
actual_capabilities: Gathers all git changes including commits, diffs, and uncommitted work
Generates PR descriptions with summary tables and visual diagrams
Creates collapsible file lists organized by category
Produces structured test plans with automated and manual steps
Updates existing PRs or creates new ones via GitHub CLI
limitations: Requires GitHub CLI (gh) and git to be installed
Does not modify source code, only PR descriptions
Cannot access private repositories without proper GitHub authentication
Output quality depends on git commit message quality

use_cases.title: Streamline PR review process
use_cases.description: Create comprehensive PR descriptions that help reviewers understand changes faster with visual aids

use_cases.title: Maintain documentation standards
use_cases.description: Enforce consistent PR description formatting across the team with structured templates

use_cases.title: Guide contributor submissions
use_cases.description: Help contributors write clear PR descriptions that reduce review time and improve contribution quality

prompt_templates.title: Basic PR description
prompt_templates.prompt: Use pr-description-writer to create a PR description for my current branch

prompt_templates.title: Update existing PR
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate a comprehensive PR description for PR #1234 using the pr-description-writer Skill

prompt_templates.title: Feature branch PR
prompt_templates.prompt: Use pr-description-writer to write a PR description for my feature branch targeting the main branch

prompt_templates.title: Multi-commit PR
prompt_templates.prompt: Analyze all commits in my current branch and create a detailed PR description with visual diagrams for the architecture changes

output_examples.input: Create a PR description for my feature branch
output: ## Summary - Brief overview of the PR purpose
### Key Features - Table of main changes
## Architecture - Mermaid diagram showing data flow
## Feature Details - Organized sections with rationale
## Files Changed - Collapsible lists by category
## How to Test - Commands and manual steps
## Notes - Breaking changes and deployment notes

best_practices: Gather complete context before writing, including all commits and uncommitted changes
Use visual diagrams for complex flows instead of lengthy prose explanations
Include both automated test commands and manual testing steps
anti_patterns: Writing vague descriptions like 'Various bug fixes' without specifics
Describing only the latest commit instead of all changes in the branch
Burying breaking changes in paragraphs instead of dedicated visible sections

faq.question: Does this skill work with GitLab or other platforms?
faq.answer: This skill is designed for GitHub using the gh CLI. Other platforms are not supported at this time.

faq.question: What git commands does this skill use?
faq.answer: It uses git log, git diff, and git status to gather changes, plus gh pr commands for GitHub operations.

faq.question: Can I customize the output format?
faq.answer: Yes, the skill follows best practices but can be customized based on your team's PR template requirements.

faq.question: Is my code or repository data sent anywhere?
faq.answer: No. All git operations run locally. Only PR creation/update calls are made to GitHub's official API.

faq.question: What if my PR has no changes to commit?
faq.answer: The skill will note that no changes are detected. Ensure you have staged or committed your changes first.

faq.question: How is this different from GitHub's PR template feature?
faq.answer: This skill actively generates content based on your actual code changes, filling in details automatically rather than just prompting for input.
